text:
BIOGRAPHICAL SKETCH
STEPHEN R. GRANT, Ph.D.

Assistant Professor
Division of Biochemistry
Department of Chemistry
University of North Texas

P.O. Box 13048
Denton, Texas 76203

Assistant Professor

Department of Biochemistry
Texas College of Osteopathic Medicine
3500 Camp Bowie Blvd,
Fort Worth, Texas 76107
EMPLOYMENT:
1968 Chemistry Laboratory Technician, Columbia Tool Steel Company, Chicago Heights,
Tlinois
1969 Senior Laboratory Technician, Columbia Tool Steel Company

1970-1974 Chemist and Laboratory Supervisor, Columbia Tool Steel Company

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE:

1983-1985 Senior Research Associate, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology,
‘The University of Texas - M.D. Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, Texas,

1986-1988 Research Assistant Professor, Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology,
‘The University of Texas - M.D. Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, Texas

1989-Present_ Assistant Professor, Department of Biochemistry, Texas College of Osteopathic
Medicine, The University of North, Texas, Fort Worth, Texas.

MEMBERSHIP IN PROFESSIONAL SOCIETIES:
1983-1985 Tissue Culture Association, Inc., Texas Chapter

1984-1988 Member, Sigma Xi, Rice University Chapter
1987-1988 Treasurer, Sigma Xi, Rice University Chapter

1988, American Society of Cell Biology
1989 ‘American Society for Biochemisiry and Molecular Biology
PUBLICATIONS:

 

West, LK. and Huang, L. (1982) A Model System for Studies of Specific
chemistry 21, 1274-1279.

   

Grant, S.R., Babbitt, B.
‘Membrane Interactions,

Grant, S.R. and Lennarz, W.J. (1983) Relationship Between Oligasaccharide-Lipid Synthesis and
Protein Synthesis in Mouse LM Cells. European Journal of Biochemistry 134, 575-583,

Kousvelari, E.E., Grant, S.R. and Baum, BJ. (1983) Beta-Adrenergic Receptor Regulation of N-linked
Protein Glycosylation in Rat Parotid Acinar Cells. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
USA 80, 7146-7150.

Kousvelari, EE., Grant, S.R. and Baum, B.J. (1983) Dolichol Phosphate Supplementation Increases
N-Linked Protein Glycosylation in Rat Parotid Acinar Cells Without Increasing Glycoprotein Secretion.
Experimental Cell Research 149, 271-276.

summary: Stefan Grant is a Ph.D. student at the University of North Texas. He is an assistant professor in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology. His work has been published in a number of scientific journals, including the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences USA.
